intro: Ilex warburgii, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and red berries. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with spiny margins, while its flowers are small and yellow-green. Ilex warburgii is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and seasonal berries.
